meanings.sent1: She misrefers the author's name in her essay.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misrefer important details in your report.
meanings.sent3: He misrefers the recipe and ends up with a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: The map misrefers the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: Misreferring can lead to confusion and misunderstandings.

meanings.definition: To make a reference to something in a mistaken or misleading way.
meanings.sent1: The news article misrefers the facts about the event.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial not to misrefer historical events in textbooks.
meanings.sent3: The comedian misrefers a famous quote for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her words misrefer reality, creating a distorted view.
meanings.sent5: Misreferring can alter the perception of truth.
